title: Home invasion where Clearwater High student shot remains under investigation
content:
The Sedgwick County Sheriff’s Office continues to investigate a reported home invasion in which a 17-year-old Clearwater High School student was shot in the abdomen, officials said Wednesday.
The 17-year-old has been released from a hospital, said sheriff’s Lt. Lin Dehning.
The incident occurred around 10:30 p.m. May 21 in the 11100 block of West 95th Street South. The 17-year-old, the only one home, reported that someone broke into the residence, the Sheriff’s Office said in a statement. “He reported that he confronted the (two) intruders and during the course of the struggle, he was shot in the abdomen,” the statement said. No items were taken.
The office asked that anyone with information about the crime call 911 or sheriff’s investigators at 316-660-5300, or Crime Stoppers, 316-267-2111. A text message can be submitted by texting TIP217 and the message to CRIMES (274637). A tip can be submitted online at www.wichitasedgwickcountycrimestoppers.com. Crime Stoppers tips are anonymous.
Reach Tim Potter at 316-268-6684 or tpotter@wichitaeagle.com.
